events.title: Security Council LIVE: UN raises alarm over deadly Iran protests and ‘possible military strikes’
events.description: The UN Security Council is meeting in New York in emergency session on Iran, amid escalating concern over reports that hundreds have been killed during weeks of nationwide anti-government protests. The meeting was requested by the United States. Demonstrations that began in late December, fuelled by soaring inflation, rising food prices and the collapse of the national currency, triggered a deadly and widespread crackdown with thousands injured and detained, according to numerous firsthand accounts. The UN has called for independent investigations into all killings and warned against the possible use of the death penalty against protesters. Follow live coverage below, and UN News app users can go here.

events.title: Chilean president declares state of catastrophe as wildfires kill at least 18
events.description: Fires blaze through 8,500 hectares, forcing 50,000 people to evacuate as firefighters struggle to extinguish flames Wildfires raging across central and southern Chile have killed at least 18 people, scorched thousands of hectares of forest and destroyed scores of homes, authorities said, as the South American country swelters under a heatwave. Chile’s president, Gabriel Boric, declared a state of catastrophe in the country’s central Biobío region and the neighbouring Ñuble region, about 500km (300 miles) south of Santiago, the capital. Continue reading...

events.title: Guatemala declares state of emergency after eight police officers killed in prison gang violence
events.description: President announces 30-day order after inmates also took 46 people hostage at three prisons Guatemala’s president has declared a 30-day nationwide state of emergency to combat criminal gangs after authorities accused them of killing eight police officers and holding hostages at three prisons. The killings occurred in the capital, Guatemal City, and surrounding areas a day after gang-affiliated inmates took 46 people hostage in the three prisons across the country to demand incarcerated gang leaders be moved to lower-security facilities. Continue reading...

events.title: UN chief warns of a world in chaos as impunity and unpredictability spreads
events.description: In his final annual address outlining his priorities, UN Secretary-General António Guterres warned that the world is “brimming with conflict, impunity, inequality and unpredictability” – even as international cooperation is fraying at the moment it is most needed.

events.title: Parents of police killed in Wieambilla urge gun buyback as Queensland set to reject federal scheme
events.description: Families call for end to political ‘bickering’ amid concerns the state LNP will not back proposed program Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast The parents of police murdered in a 2022 ambush in western Queensland have thrown their support behind the federal government’s proposed gun buyback scheme in the wake of the Bondi beach terror attack. The Guardian understands that the state LNP government decided not to support the buyback program at a marathon cabinet meeting on Monday. Continue reading...

events.title: Will AI kickstart a new age of nuclear power?
events.description: The rapidly expanding use of artificial intelligence worldwide is putting electrical grids under huge pressure and many believe that, to meet that need without contributing to the climate crisis, a full-scale expansion of nuclear energy is essential.

events.title: Surfer injured in fourth shark attack in Australian state in 48 hours
events.description: Authorities are warning people to stay out of the Australian state's waterways after recent rainfall.

events.title: Iran protests: What we know about the varying death tolls
events.description: What is the death toll from the protests in Iran? Since the demonstrations broke out against the theocratic regime late December, the number reported has continued to rise...though it has been harder than ever to verify an exact count with an internet blackout in the country hindering communications. As of 19 January, two main rights groups confirmed nearly 4000 deaths, though the figure is likely a significate underestimate. Vedika Bahl goes through what we know in Truth or Fake.

events.title: Chile fights wildfires that killed 19 and forced massive evacuations
events.description: Firefighters in Chile are battling forest fires that have killed at least 19 people and left around 1,500 homeless

events.title: Sudan: Atrocities ‘repeated town by town’, ICC prosecutor tells UN Security Council
events.description: Atrocities in Sudan’s Darfur region are spreading from town to town in an organized campaign of violence that includes mass executions, rape and ethnic targeting, amounting to war crimes and crimes against humanity, the prosecutor of the International Criminal Court told the UN Security Council on Monday.

events.title: Viral protest video against Iran’s supreme leader sparks copycat demonstrations worldwide
events.description: Viral video shows Iranian refugee lighting cigarette with burning photo of supreme leader, sparking global defiance movement amid Iran protests.

events.title: Uganda’s president calls opponents 'terrorists' in victory speech
events.description: Yoweri Museveni wins seventh term but poll criticised by observers and rights groups over repression of opposition and internet blackout Uganda’s president, Yoweri Museveni, fresh from winning a seventh term in office at 81, said on Sunday that the opposition were “terrorists” who had tried to use violence to overturn the election results. Official results showed Museveni winning a landslide with 72% of the vote , but the poll was criticised by African election observers and rights groups due to the heavy repression of the opposition and an internet blackout. Continue reading...

events.title: China’s economy hit growth target last year despite Trump trade war and property crisis
events.description: Economy weathered a fraught geopolitical landscape to reach 5% goal but domestic structural challenges ‘not going away’, say experts China’s population falls again as birthrate hits record low Business live – latest updates China has said its economy grew 5% last year, hitting Beijing’s official target as the world’s second-largest economy overcame Donald Trump’s tariff war with a record trade surplus. Data released on Monday by Beijing’s National Bureau of Statistics showed the Chinese economy hit the official target of “around” 5% – the same growth as in 2024 – despite a slowdown to 4.5% in the final three months of the year. Continue reading...

events.title: Tributes pour in after death of Italian designer Valentino
events.description: Italian designer Valentino Garavani, whose luxurious dresses adorned some of the world's most elegant women from Jackie Kennedy to Audrey Hepburn, has died aged 93, his foundation said on Monday. Valentino's death comes just months after the passing of another Italian style legend, Giorgio Armani, and there were tributes from the global fashion world and beyond. FRANCE 24's Seema Gupta reports from Rome.

events.title: Spain train crash: What we know about the fatal derailment so far
events.description: At least 40 people have been killed and 170 others injured after two high-speed trains derailed in southern Spain on Sunday.

events.title: Bodies of 23 recovered from shopping centre fire in Pakistan, as dozens remain missing
events.description: Rescuers have recovered the bodies of at least 23 people killed in a massive fire at a shopping centre in Pakistan, with dozens still missing.

events.title: Russia plots major strike on Europe's largest nuclear plant power lines: source
events.description: Ukraine nuclear facilities face Russian attack threats as Moscow weighs strikes on power substations to force capitulation, officials say. Zaporizhzhia is a primary target.

events.title: World Economic Forum boots Iranian foreign minister from Davos summit amid deadly crackdown on protesters
events.description: World Economic Forum withdraws Iranian foreign minister's Davos invitation amid deadly nationwide protests that have killed thousands of civilians.

events.title: ‘Brazen’ political influence of rich laid bare as wealth of billionaires reaches $18.3tn, says Oxfam
events.description: Governments opting for oligarchy while brutally repressing protests over austerity and lack of jobs, charity report says The world saw a record number of billionaires created last year, with a collective wealth of $18.3tn (£13.7tn), while global efforts stalled in the fight against poverty and hunger. Oxfam’s annual survey of global inequality has revealed that the number of billionaires surpassed 3,000 for the first time during 2025. Since 2020, their collective wealth grew by 81%, or $8.2tn, which the charity claims would be enough to eradicate global poverty 26 times over. Continue reading...

events.title: Spain seeks answers as high-speed train crash toll rises to 40
events.description: The death toll from a high-speed train collision in southern Spain rose to 40 on Monday as the government vowed a full investigation into its causes. The crash late on Sunday is Spain's deadliest train accident since 2013, when 80 people died after a train veered off a curved section of track outside the northwestern city of Santiago de Compostela. FRANCE 24's Emerald Maxwell reports.

events.title: ‘Alarming’ increase in use of death penalty last year, despite global trend towards abolition
events.description: Despite a downward trend in the use of the death penalty globally, 2025 saw an ‘alarming’ increase in the number of executions in a small number of retentionist countries, the UN human rights office (OHCHR) warned on Monday.

events.title: Amid Sudan’s humanitarian crisis, Chad shows ‘act of solidarity’
events.description: In war-torn Sudan, local communities say they don’t have enough settlements for the internally displaced, few solutions for women who have suffered sexual violence – and there’s a lack of aid available for people with disabilities.

events.title: WFP warns Sudan food aid could run out in March
events.description: The World Food Programme (WFP) said on Thursday that it is struggling to keep emergency operations running in Sudan, where more than 1,000 days of war have pushed families to the brink.

events.title: Senegal awaits return of AFCON champions
events.description: In tonight's edition, Senegal eagerly awaited the return of its champions on Monday, with the population given a national holiday after the country's AFCON win over Morocco. Also, the Congolese army says it has regained control of the city of Uvira following the withdrawal of the M23 armed group. And heavy rains have flooded South Africa, Mozambique, and Zimbabwe, overwhelming rivers and infrastructure.

events.title: 9 Guatemalan police officers dead after gang attacks
events.description: The death toll from suspected gang attacks on Guatemalan police has risen to 10, as Guatemalans saw heavier security in the streets and curtailed rights after Congress approved President Bernardo Arévalo’s emergency declaration

events.title: Myanmar begins defence in landmark genocide case at UN World Court
events.description: Myanmar on Friday rejected allegations of genocide against the Rohingya minority, telling the International Court of Justice (ICJ) that the Gambia’s case rests on “unsubstantiated allegations,” as public hearings continued in a landmark case on the application of the Genocide Convention.

events.title: Episcopal bishop warns clergy to prepare for 'new era of martyrdom' after ICE shooting
events.description: An Episcopal bishop warned New Hampshire clergy to prepare wills for "new era of martyrdom" after woman killed in ICE shooting, urging readiness.

events.title: Game-changing international ocean treaty comes into force
events.description: Almost two decades in the making, an international agreement to protect and sustainably use marine life in international waters and the international seabed is due to come into force on Saturday, marking a major step forward in efforts to ensure the health of ocean ecosystems for decades to come.

events.title: Iran: UN urges ‘maximum restraint’ to avert more death, wider escalation
events.description: As nationwide protests in Iran appear to ease after nearly three weeks of unrest and bloodshed, a senior UN official called on Thursday for action to prevent further escalation.

events.title: After four shark attacks in 48 hours, NSW authorities urge beachgoers ‘just go to a pool’
events.description: Surfer taken to hospital with minor injuries after latest shark attack at Point Plomer beach on mid-north coast Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast A surfer has been taken to hospital after being bitten by a shark off the coast of New South Wales’ Limeburners Creek national park, the state’s fourth incident in 48 hours. The local health district said the man, 39, was in hospital in a stable condition with minor injuries. The attack took place near the Point Plomer campground, less than 20km north of Port Macquarie, on Tuesday morning. Continue reading...

events.title: At least 39 dead in Spain train collision
events.description: At least 39 people were killed in a high-speed train collision in southern Spain Sunday, police said. Efforts to recover the bodies are continuing, and the death toll is likely to rise.

events.title: Trump threatens 200% tariff on French wine over Macron's refusal to join 'Board of Peace'
events.description: US President Donald Trump threatened to impose 200 percent tariffs on French wines and Champagnes on Monday evening, a measure he said was intended to convince his French counterpart Emmanuel Macron to join his "Board of Peace" aimed at resolving global conflicts.

events.title: Hackers target Iran state TV's satellite transmission to broadcast exiled crown prince
events.description: Hackers disrupted Iranian state television satellite transmissions to air footage supporting the country's exiled crown prince and calling on security forces to not “point your weapons at the people,” online video showed early Monday, the latest disruption to follow nationwide protests in the country. FRANCE 24's Jennie Shin reports.

events.title: North Korea's Kim purges vice premier, slams ‘incompetent’ officials
events.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un abruptly sacked a vice premier and lashed out at “incompetent” officials in a rare public rebuke, state media reported Tuesday. The move came as Kim opened a major industrial complex, underscoring growing pressure on officials to deliver economic gains under heavy international sanctions.

events.title: Gaza humanitarian crisis ‘far from being over,’ UN aid coordination office warns
events.description: Three months into the ceasefire in the Gaza Strip, the UN and partners have delivered tonnes of assistance items and carried out critical repairs, but this is only a temporary “Band-Aid” solution, a veteran aid worker has warned.

events.title: New Orleans tourists shot when man fleeing gunfire ducks into famed restaurant
events.description: Three tourists wounded in a deadly New Orleans shooting at the famed Dooky Chase's Restaurant when a man ran inside to escape gunfire, authorities said.

events.title: Guatemala mourns 10 police slain by gangsters amid state of emergency
events.description: State of emergency imposed after gang violence allows police to arrest suspected criminals without judicial order.

events.title: Nigeria: Gunmen kidnap more than 160 in church attacks
events.description: Armed gangs with "sophisticated weapons" kidnapped worshipers from at least two churches in Kaduna state. Nigeria faces several internal conflicts that have affected both Christians and Muslims — often indiscriminately.

events.title: Islamic State group claims deadly blast at Chinese restaurant in Kabul
events.description: A blast ripped through a Chinese restaurant in central Kabul on Monday, killing at least seven people and wounding more than a dozen others, officials said, in an attack later claimed by the Islamic State group and reported to have targeted Chinese nationals.

events.title: Greenland threats: Europe 'must be ready to respond in kind', expert says
events.description: Speaking with FRANCE 24's Mark Owen, Scott Lucas, Professor of International Politics at the Clinton Institute at the University of Dublin, says that Europe must be 'ready to respond in kind' if the US proceeds with the threat of punitive tariffs for the eight European countries that oppose plans to take over Greenland.

events.title: Aurora australis set to light up Australian sky as agencies monitor ‘severe solar storm’
events.description: The spectacular aurora australis, also known as the southern lights, may be visible as far north as Victoria and New South Wales A ‘severe’ solar storm, which is being monitored by the National Emergency Management Agency, could make auroras visible in Australia as well as cause disruptions to the power grid. Here’s what you need to know about the solar storm. Continue reading...

events.title: More than 5,600 Kyiv residential buildings left without heat after Russian attack
events.description: A Russian air strike overnight into Tuesday left more than 5,600 Kyiv homes without power amid -14C temperatures, according to mayor Vitaly Klitschko. The new attack comes 10 days after Russia's worst attack on the Ukrainian capital's energy grid.

events.title: IS group prisoners are 'big issue' for Syrian government and Kurdish SDF
events.description: A day after the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) agreed to quit large parts of Syria under a ceasefire, the Syrian army said "a number of" Islamic State (IS) group prisoners, who had been under SDF control, had escaped. The SDF said it ​lost control of a prison following an attack by government fighters. FRANCE 24's Wassim Nasr notes that IS group prisoners are an important issue in Syria today.

events.title: Iran state TV hacked to show exiled Crown Prince Pahlavi
events.description: Iranian state TV hacked to show exiled Crown Prince Reza Pahlavi urging military to join protesters as death toll reportedly reaches nearly 4,000.

events.title: IMF warns of trade tension risk to global growth
events.description: Trade tensions and a reversal in the AI boom are among the main risks to global economic growth, the IMF says.

events.title: South African team helps search for politician swept away by Mozambique floodwaters
events.description: Mozambique President Daniel Chapo cancels a trip to Davos due to severe floods in the country

events.title: Why Germany probably won't get political at 2026 World Cup
events.description: After their very public protest at the last World Cup in Qatar, Germany's football team looks unlikely to do the same in the United States in 2026.

events.title: Guterres in London: Humanity strongest when we stand as one
events.description: Powerful forces are lining up to undermine global cooperation, United Nations Secretary-General António Guterres warned at a landmark event in London on Saturday to commemorate the 80th anniversary of the General Assembly, but he urged that “humanity is strongest when we stand as one”.

events.title: World News in Brief: Gaza education update, the General Assembly at 80, Venezuela’s humanitarian needs
events.description: More children in war-ravaged Gaza are now back in the classroom, the UN aid coordination office (OCHA) said on Friday.

events.title: European leaders warn Trump tariffs over Greenland 'risk a dangerous downward spiral'
events.description: European leaders unite against Trump's tariff threats over Greenland acquisition, warning of damage to transatlantic relations as tensions escalate.

events.title: What we know about Spain's worst rail disaster in over a decade
events.description: What caused the train to derail remains unclear but officials say an investigation has been launched.

events.title: Thirteen schoolchildren killed after bus collides with lorry in South Africa
events.description: The fatal collision is just the latest in South Africa, where the road safety record is poor.

events.title: Man seriously injured in Sydney's third shark attack in two days
events.description: In three separate incidents, a 12-year-old was also injured and an 11-year-old received assistance after his surfboard was bitten.

events.title: More than 100 vehicle pile-up leaves US motorists stranded in snowstorm
events.description: US weather forecasters warn of extremely cold temperatures, potential for winter storms across several states.

events.title: Invasion Day and anti-immigration marches to proceed in Sydney on 26 January after protest ban scaled back
events.description: Police commissioner Mal Lanyon says demonstration rules – imposed after Bondi attacks – have ‘taken heat out of the community’ The New South Wales police commissioner has extended a restriction on protests in Sydney for a third time, but narrowed the area it covers in a bid to get “the balance right between community safety and a right to protest” ahead of Invasion Day. On Tuesday afternoon, Mal Lanyon, said the restrictions would no longer include Hyde Park, allowing police to authorise the major annual Invasion Day protest to march from that location to Victoria Park on Monday. Continue reading...

events.title: 'A head-spinning day of crisis meetings all over Europe' as Trump reiterates push for Greenland
events.description: The EU said on Monday it wanted to engage with the United States after President Donald Trump threatened tariffs on European countries in the standoff over Greenland, but was ready to act if needed. FRANCE 24's Brussels correspondent Dave Keating says that 'there are signs of split between European leaders as the reality sets in'.

events.title: What may have caused deadly train crash in Spain - and why it's been described as 'truly strange'
events.description: A faulty rail joint may be key to understanding the cause of one of Spain's deadliest railway disasters in years, experts have said.

events.title: Canadian woman found dead on Australian beach in suspected dingo attack
events.description: Authorities are investigating whether a Canadian woman found dead on an Australian beach was killed by dingoes

events.title: Aid cuts push millions in West and Central Africa deeper into hunger
events.description: A staggering 55 million people across West and Central Africa are expected to suffer crisis levels of hunger, or worse, during the lean season from June to August as funding cuts to humanitarian operations continue amid rising violence and displacement.

events.title: In Gaza, 800,000 people now live in dangerous locations prone to flooding
events.description: Fighting the harsh winter storms in Gaza, Amina stays awake at night, hitting the canvas of the tent above her head to prevent it from collapsing under the pooled water.

events.title: Florida repeat offender allegedly killed 3 tourists minutes from Magic Kingdom after run of violence: records
events.description: Florida man accused of killing three tourists near Magic Kingdom had lengthy criminal history including prior insanity acquittal for attempted murder.

events.title: UFO task force eyed as lawmaker warns of strange objects in skies and waters defying known technology
events.description: Vermont UFO task force proposed by Rep. Troy Headrick would investigate unidentified anomalous phenomena reports and assess airspace safety risks in coordination with federal partners.

events.title: California hiker found dead after striking out to search for missing group
events.description: A hiker was found dead in the California mountains after searching for lost friends, authorities said. Rescue teams successfully saved the initial four missing hikers.

events.title: Australian boy fighting for life after shark attack, rescued by friends in Sydney Harbor waters
events.description: A 12-year-old boy is fighting for his life after a catastrophic shark attack in Sydney Harbor. He was rescued by heroic friends who leaped from a cliff to save him.

events.title: US believes its power matters more than international law, UN chief tells BBC
events.description: António Guterres says Washington's "clear conviction" is that multilateral solutions are irrelevant.

events.title: They bought an abandoned 'ghost house' in the Japanese countryside
events.description: He'd spent years backpacking around the world, and Japanese traveler Daisuke Kajiyama was finally ready to return home to pursue his long-held dream of opening up a guesthouse.

events.title: Trump's Board of Peace requires nations pay $1 billion for permanent membership
events.description: President Trump's Board of Peace is part of his next steps for Gaza. Its charter includes broad international powers for Trump and a $1 billion contribution from nations seeking permanent membership.

events.title: Why Myanmar election won't change Europe's mind on junta
events.description: Seeking international legitimacy, Myanmar's ruling military junta claims elections this week are a return to democracy. But it will take more than the junta's word to convince the EU that the polls are free and fair.

events.title: Floods in Mozambique displace more than 300,000 people in one province, governor says
events.description: Flooding in Mozambique has displaced over 300,000 people, according to the Gaza province governor

events.title: Anti-ICE agitators disrupt Minnesota church, shout down worshippers during Sunday service
events.description: Anti-ICE protesters allegedly disrupted Minneapolis church services, shouting at parishioners over immigration enforcement. Federal investigation launched.

events.title: Iran locks nation into ‘darker’ digital blackout, viewing internet as an ‘existential threat’
events.description: Iran enters 22nd day of internet shutdown with limited connectivity restored as NetBlocks reports shift toward "filternet plus" censorship scheme whitelisting only business services.

events.title: Top GOP senator says Syria ceasefire welcome but actions must match words
events.description: Syria reaches fragile ceasefire with Kurdish forces as U.S. senator warns about reported crimes by government troops during military operation against SDF.

events.title: Iran accused of killing 16,500 in sweeping ‘genocide’ crackdown: report
events.description: Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei acknowledges thousands killed in Iran protests as regime allegedly accelerates executions to more than eight per day.

events.title: Iran ‘just getting started’ on punishing ‘rioters’ arrested during protests
events.description: Authorities are confiscating assets of people backing protesters to pay for damages incurred during the unrest.

events.title: Rare twins born in DRC raise cautious hope for endangered mountain gorillas
events.description: Virunga park ranger says babies are well cared for by mother Mafuko but high infant mortality makes first weeks critical It was noon by the time Jacques Katutu first saw the newborn mountain gorillas. Cradled in the arms of their mother, Mafuko, the tiny twins clung to her body for warmth in the forest clearing in Virunga national park, in eastern Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC). Katutu, head of gorilla monitoring in Virunga, has seen dozens of newborns in his 15 years as a ranger. But, he tells the Guardian, even he was touched by the sight of the fragile infant males, who face serious obstacles if they are to become silverbacks one day. Continue reading...

events.title: Northern lights dazzle US, Europe amid intense solar storm
events.description: The sun has ejected the largest solar radiation storm in over 20 years. The phenomenon caused auroras to light up the skies in some parts of the world.

events.title: Davos 2026: Europeans address forum ahead of Trump visit
events.description: European leaders are taking center stage at the World Economic Forum in Davos, a day ahead of US President Donald Trump's visit. His threat of tariffs over Greenland is set to loom over the summit's agenda. DW has more.

events.title: EU leaders take stage in Davos as Trump dangles tariff threats over Greenland
events.description: European leaders step into the spotlight at Davos on Tuesday, hoping to steady fraying transatlantic ties before US President Donald Trump arrives with fresh tariff threats aimed at the EU over Greenland. Trump is set to dominate the World Economic Forum this week, as Washington’s hard-edged agenda rattles allies and forces Europe to weigh its response.

events.title: Fighting erupts near prisons holding IS extremists one day after ceasefire agreed
events.description: Fighting has broken out between Syrian government troops and the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF), just a day after a ceasefire was announced by the country's state media.

events.title: Colombia's ELN rebels free 5 police officers as they push for national accord
events.description: Colombia’s largest remaining rebel group on Monday released five police officers it had kidnapped during the first week of January, as it pushes for a “national accord” to overcome political conflicts in the South American nation

events.title: Syria-SDF ceasefire hangs in balance after renewed clashes, faltering talks
events.description: Syria’s government, Kurdish-led forces trade blame on violence, escaped ISIL fighters as negotiations reach dead end.

events.title: Train crash kills more than three dozen in Spain
events.description: More than three dozen people were killed as two high-speed trains collided in southern Spain.

events.title: 'Sentimental Value' sweeps European Film Awards. Next step, Oscars?
events.description: Joachim Trier's drama won the top accolades, adding to the buzz ahead of the Oscar awards. Iran was also in the spotlight, with director Jafar Panahi decrying the government's brutal crackdown on protest.

events.title: Live: Trump says Europeans won't 'push back too much' over Greenland
events.description: US President Donald Trump claimed late on Monday that Europeans would not "push back too much" on his bid for Greenland. EU leaders will hold an emergency summit in Brussels Thursday to discuss their response as the US president dangles tariff threats against eight European countries opposed to his plan. Follow our liveblog for all the latest developments.

events.title: Trump administration 'clearly within its rights' to seek federal law enforced, expert says
events.description: The Pentagon has ordered about 1,500 active-duty soldiers in Alaska to ⁠prepare for a possible deployment to Minnesota, the site of large protests against the government's deportation drive, according to reports. Speaking on FRANCE 24, Ilan Wurman, Professor of Law at the University of Minnesota, explains that, from a legal perspective, the Trump administration is 'clearly within its rights' to seek to have the federal law enforced.

events.title: World News in Brief: Food insecurity in Lebanon, Libya migrants freed, UNHCR tackles multiple emergencies – despite cuts
events.description: Since 2026, nearly 17 percent of Lebanon’s population has been living in a state of major food insecurity – a situation that is likely to worsen in the coming year.

events.title: Yemen: Children are dying and it’s going to get worse, warns aid veteran
events.description: In Yemen, renewed political instability and economic woes linked to the war threaten to complicate the already difficult task of helping vulnerable people suffering from deepening hunger, illness and displacement, the UN’s top aid official there said on Monday.

events.title: Peacekeeping: Lacroix warns of rising threats to ‘blue helmets’ in Middle East
events.description: Peacekeeping operations in the Middle East are facing mounting security risks, funding pressures and political uncertainty, the head of UN peacekeeping warned on Friday.

events.title: Judge and wife shot in broad daylight in Indiana, sparking massive multi-agency investigation
events.description: A manhunt is underway after Indiana judge Steven Meyer and his wife, Kimberly Meyer, were shot in their home on Sunday. Both victims survived the shooting.

events.title: Australia closes dozens of east coast beaches after shark attacks
events.description: NSW coastline has seen four shark attacks since Sunday, as experts say rainy conditions draw sharks to beach areas.

events.title: These were the best and worst places for air quality in 2021, new report shows
events.description: Air pollution spiked to unhealthy levels around the world in 2021, according to a new report.

events.title: Japan’s prime minister calls snap election as approval ratings ride high
events.description: Sanae Takaichi tells senior figures in ruling Liberal Democratic party she plans to dissolve lower house on 23 January Japan’s prime minister, Sanae Takaichi , has called a snap election as she attempts to capitalise on high approval ratings since becoming the country’s first female prime minister three months ago. Takaichi, a conservative who is embroiled in a deepening dispute with China over the security of Taiwan, said on Monday she would dissolve the lower house of the Diet – Japan’s parliament – on 23 January, with an election to follow on 8 February. Continue reading...

events.title: Virginia Bell formally commences royal commission role – as it happened
events.description: This blog is now closed Liberal leader claims credit for ‘fixing’ Labor’s hate speech laws as they pass lower house Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast The attorney general, Michelle Rowland, says the two bills on gun control and hate speech will be introduced to parliament this morning and that there has been “constructive engagement” with the Coalition over the last 48 hours. But on whether that deal is signed, sealed and delivered, Rowland, speaking on the ABC’s Radio National Breakfast, won’t guarantee the Coalition will support the bill when introduced and she says she won’t “pre-empt” anything. I don’t want to pre-empt any of those conversations, and particularly since they have been undertaken in good faith … some of those issues go around the listing of hate groups and that framework. And it is a fact that the opposition has sought a number of amendments to this area. I will point out that the removal of the serious vilification provisions do mean that these remaining provisions in the prohibited hate groups section do need to do a lot of work. I think we’re really close. I mean, effectively, the laws won’t be as strong as what the government wants them to be, and that’s been public for a while. But importantly, this will still involve the strongest hate speech laws that Australia’s ever had. We’ve got to deal with the parliament that we have, and I can’t see a pathway in the current parliament. Continue reading...

events.title: China's economy is rising, but many citizens are left behind, analysts say
events.description: China's National Bureau of Statistics released data on its 2025 GDP growth Monday. Analysts say it reveals strong economic growth for the country, but ordinary people still face deep challenges.

events.title: Hollywood stars lead tributes to designer Valentino
events.description: Tributes have flooded in for designer Valentino, who has been hailed as an "eternal symbol of Italian high fashion".

events.title: Moderate earthquake kills 1 person, damages dozens of homes in northern Pakistan
events.description: Authorities say a magnitude 5.8 earthquake has struck northern Pakistan, killing at least one person and damaging dozens of homes

events.title: Spain to hold three days of mourning for victims of high-speed train crash
events.description: At least 40 people died in Sunday's collision in southern Spain, the worst crash the country has seen in more than a decade.

events.title: Lawyers for Swiss bar owners condemn 'vindictiveness' after deadly fire
events.description: Lawyers for the Moretti couple say "lies" have been circulating about their clients, in their first public statement since the fire.

events.title: Clashes reported after Syria and Kurdish-led forces agree ceasefire
events.description: An agreement between the government and the SDF will bring an autonomous region in the north-east under state control.

events.title: US Fed Chair Powell to attend Supreme Court session on Cook case: Report
events.description: Powell appears to be casting off last year’s more subdued response to Trump’s repeated attacks on the Fed, AP reported.

events.title: Sheinbaum reassures Mexico after US military movements spark concern
events.description: Mexico is showing sensitivity to U.S. military movements since the attack earlier this month on Venezuela

events.title: Anti-ICE agitators occupy Minnesota Target store, demand retailer stop helping federal agents
events.description: Anti-ICE protesters staged a sit-in at Minneapolis Target store, claiming retailer allows federal immigration agents to use parking lot as staging ground.

events.title: Fox News Campus Radicals Newsletter: Teachers unions' far-left activism, campus threats against VP Vance
events.description: Stay up to date with the Fox News Campus Radicals newsletter, which brings you the in-depth investigative stories from college campuses nationwide.

events.title: Viral video shows ICE agent telling agitators they're disrupting arrest of child sex offender in Minnesota
events.description: Viral video shows alleged interference with ICE operation targeting suspected child sex offender in Minnesota. Federal agents confronted by protesters.

events.title: World Economic Forum at Davos 2026: Dates, location and what to expect
events.description: Every year, the World Economic Forum meeting takes place at the Swiss Alpine resort of Davos.

events.title: The surreal facades of America's strip clubs
events.description: Some people travel the world in search of adventure, while others seek out natural wonders, cultural landmarks or culinary experiences. But French photographer François Prost was looking for something altogether different during his recent road trip across America: strip clubs.

events.title: Italian fashion designer Valentino dies at 93
events.description: Garavani built one of the most recognizable luxury brands in the world. His clients included royalty, Hollywood stars, and first ladies.

events.title: Trump attends World Economic Forum amid U.S.-European tensions over Greenland
events.description: President Trump is attending the World Economic Forum meeting in Davos this year with fellow world leaders who seek answers on Ukraine and Gaza.

events.title: A chance to negotiate as Trump heads to Davos - but Starmer is the odd one out
events.description: This time last year Donald Trump was beamed into Davos from Washington to deliver a virtual address that put business and political leaders on notice; the free-trading, liberal economic model, reaffirmed and celebrated every January at the World Economic Forum, was over.

events.title: Six countries confirm US invitations to Gaza peace board
events.description: Trump invites multiple countries, including Jordan, Greece and India, to join his "Board of Peace" for Gaza reconstruction and governance oversight.

events.title: World Economic Forum invites Iranian foreign minister to Davos after regime slaughter of Iranian civilians
events.description: World Economic Forum is facing calls to exclude Iranian officials from Davos after the regime slaughtered thousands of its civilians, rights groups say.

events.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 1,426
events.description: These are the key developments from day 1,426 of Russia’s war on Ukraine.

events.title: Retail spending fell in March as consumers pull back
events.description: Spending at US retailers fell in March as consumers pulled back amid recessionary fears fueled by the banking crisis.

events.title: Yoweri Museveni wins Ugandan election as opponent condemns ‘fake result’
events.description: Museveni’s opponent, Bobi Wine, alleges that members of polling staff were kidnapped and called for peaceful protests Yoweri Museveni, has won the Ugandan election and his seventh term with more than 70% of the vote, state election authorities have said, amid an internet shutdown and claims of fraud by his opponent. His opponent, a youthful musician known as Bobi Wine, condemned what he called “fake results” and alleged that members of polling staff were kidnapped, among other election irregularities. He called for peaceful protests to pressure the authorities to release what he called the “rightful results”. Continue reading...

events.title: Brazil’s Bolsonaro finds novel way to reduce 27-year sentence: reading books
events.description: Former president convicted for coup plot to take advantage of law that knocks four days off jail term for each book read Jair Bolsonaro’s lawyers appear to have been reading up on the country’s penal code and have found a way to help their client reduce the 27-year prison sentence he received last year for plotting a coup: by reading books. There is only one problem: the former far-right Brazilian president has never been known as a bibliophile. “Sorry, I don’t have time to read,” Bolsonaro once declared. “It’s been three years since I read a book.” Continue reading...

events.title: Australia hit by 4 shark attacks in 2 days
events.description: A surfer has been attacked by a shark in the fourth incident along the coast of New South Wales in 48 hours. Meanwhile, beaches have been closed across Sydney.

events.title: Germany cautiously thankful for US 'Board of Peace' invite
events.description: Germany has said peace in Gaza is a "core interest" but added Berlin sees the UN as the place to resolve conflict. The US plan received mixed reviews and will likely ruffle feathers with an invitation for Vladimir Putin.

events.title: Trump writes Norway's PM, ties Greenland to peace prize snub
events.description: The US president wrote to complain about not getting a Nobel Peace Prize, a decision that doesn't rest with Norway's PM. He said he would devote more thought to US interests, after having "stopped 8 Wars PLUS."

events.title: Gunmen abduct more than 150 Christians in mass kidnapping
events.description: Armed bandits have kidnapped more than 150 Christians in simultaneous attacks on a number of churches in Nigeria.

events.title: Gunmen abduct over 150 worshippers from 3 churches in Nigeria
events.description: Gunmen have abducted more than 150 worshippers in simultaneous attacks on three churches in northwest Nigeria

events.title: UN rights chief bears witness to trauma and resilience in Sudan
events.description: Nearly three years of war have plunged Sudan “into an abyss of unimaginable dimensions” and human rights must be at the centre of efforts to end the fighting and build lasting peace, the UN High Commissioner for Human Rights said on Sunday in Nairobi.

events.title: ICE says immigrant who died in Texas detention center committed suicide
events.description: ICE said that an immigrant who was found dead at an immigration detention center in El Paso, Texas, last week had killed himself, as authorities continue to investigate.

events.title: Minneapolis software engineers mistaken for ICE agents while eating lunch harassed by anti-ICE crowd
events.description: Software engineers mistakenly accused of being ICE agents face harassment and shocking allegations while eating lunch at Minneapolis restaurant during incident.

events.title: Florida triple murder of 3 tourists was 'senseless,' 'random,' sheriff says
events.description: Florida man accused of randomly shooting three stranded tourists at Kissimmee rental home. Ahmad Bojeh arrested and charged with premeditated murder.

events.title: Iranian regime elites allegedly move millions of dollars out of country amid sanctions
events.description: Treasury sanctions target Iran's shadow banking as Mojtaba Khamenei allegedly transferred $328 million overseas according to Treasury Department reports.

events.title: Ukrainian drone strikes leave hundreds of thousands without power across Russian-controlled area
events.description: Ukrainian drone strikes against Russian energy infrastructure left over 200,000 without power as both sides continue targeting electrical grids.

events.title: Argentina's bungled hunt for Hitler's right-hand man Martin Bormann revealed in declassified files
events.description: Files show Argentina's bungled hunt for Hitler's henchman Martin Bormann, marked by mistaken arrests and bureaucratic incompetence in the post-war era.

events.title: Syrian army, SDF start implementing ceasefire despite clashes
events.description: Despite some reported clashes, the Syrian army and the Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) are implementing a new ceasefire.

events.title: Trump escalates tensions across Europe with new threats about Greenland acquisition
events.description: President Trump said the U.S. will impose tariffs on eight European countries until the U.S. acquires Greenland. The announcement came as a congressional delegation visited Denmark to ease tensions.

events.title: Former diplomat on Trump's tariff threats against NATO allies over Greenland issue
events.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep asks Kurt Volker, a former U.S. ambassador to NATO, about what critics perceive as the Trump administration's threat to the transatlantic alliance.

events.title: US veteran gets 5 years in Russian prison after authorities reportedly force him to dock with firearm onboard
events.description: U.S. Navy veteran Charles Wayne Zimmerman was sentenced to 5 years in Russian prison after allegedly failing to declare a firearm oboard his yacht in Sochi port.

events.title: Denmark sends more troops to Greenland amid tensions with Trump
events.description: Nordic country dispatches 'substantial contribution' of troops to the Arctic territory amid standoff with Washington.

events.title: Silicon Valley Bank collapse renews calls to address disparities impacting entrepreneurs of color
events.description: When customers at Silicon Valley Bank rushed to withdraw billions of dollars last month, venture capitalist Arlan Hamilton stepped in to help some of the founders of color who panicked about losing access to payroll funds.

events.title: Trump administration says deporting college student trying to surprise family was a ‘mistake’
events.description: Any Lucía López Belloza was detained at Boston’s airport in November and flown to Honduras two days later US citizens and permanent residents: have you been racially profiled by ICE? The Trump administration apologized in court for a “mistake” in the deportation of a Massachusetts college student who was detained trying to fly home to surprise her family in Texas for Thanksgiving. But the administration still argued that the federal government error should not affect her immigration case. Continue reading...

events.title: CIA chief visits Maduro successor as Machado vows to become Venezuela’s president
events.description: John Ratcliffe meets Delcy Rodríguez in Caracas less than two weeks after his agents helped to oust her precedessor The CIA chief whose agents reputedly played a key role in abducting Nicolás Maduro has flown to Venezuela to meet his successor as the sidelined opposition leader, María Corina Machado, vowed she would become the country’s first elected female president. Machado’s comments were broadcast on Friday, a day after she handed her Nobel peace prize medal to Donald Trump in recognition of what she called a principled and decisive move against Maduro, whom US special forces snatched on 3 January. Continue reading...

events.title: China expected to get London embassy go-ahead this week after years of wrangling
events.description: Decision expected on Monday or Tuesday, potentially smoothing relations before Keir Starmer’s visit to China Why Chinese ‘mega embassy’ is not such a worry for British spies A decision on China’s proposed mega embassy in London is expected on Monday or Tuesday, with Chinese officials and British diplomats in Beijing holding their breath in anticipation of the planning application finally being approved. The saga, which has been running since 2018, is widely expected to end with the British government giving the green light for construction. If it does, one group likely to be grateful is those who work in the British embassy’s dilapidated building in Beijing. The UK’s plans to redevelop its outpost in China’s capital have been blocked for years by the Chinese government because of the London embassy row. Continue reading...

events.title: Trump says he's pursuing Greenland after perceived Nobel Peace Prize snub
events.description: "Considering your Country decided not to give me the Nobel Peace Prize… I no longer feel an obligation to think purely of Peace," Trump wrote in a message to the Norwegian Prime Minister.

events.title: IS fighters flee prison as Syria's army clashes with SDF
events.description: Hundreds of IS members escaped a prison amid clashes between Syrian government forces and the SDF, the country's main Kurdish-led force.

events.title: Universal Orlando visitor dies after riding Revenge of the Mummy roller coaster, state report says
events.description: A 70-year-old woman died after riding Universal Orlando's Revenge of the Mummy roller coaster in November, according to a new state report.

events.title: Trump says he will '100%' carry out Greenland tariffs threat, as EU vows to protect its interests
events.description: Kaja Kallas, the EU's foreign policy chief, said the bloc has "no interest to pick a fight, but we will hold our ground".

events.title: Syria fighting live: Ceasefire under duress as army moves into Hasakah
events.description: About 200 ISIL detainees escaped from al-Shaddadi prison with tit-for-tat allegations on who freed them.

events.title: North Korea’s Kim Jong Un fires vice premier, publicly rebukes officials
events.description: Kim condemns 'incompetent' party members for delays in government projects in advance of key ruling party meeting.

events.title: North Korean leader fires vice premier, slams 'incompetent' officials
events.description: North Korea's leader Kim Jong Un publicly dismissed a cabinet vice premier over a factory project. He also blasted officials for "defeatism" and "irresponsibility."

events.title: How can the EU respond to US 'blackmail' over Greenland?
events.description: European leaders have three main options for responding to the Trump administration’s economic threats. If they don’t get it right, Trump may be emboldened to take over Greenland.

events.title: Germany updates: Berlin brings back EV subsidies
events.description: The German government has reintroduced subsidies for electric vehicles, but the move is under fire for including hybrids. Meanwhile, the IMF is predicting stronger economic growth in 2026. Follow DW.

events.title: Congolese army 'retakes strategic city of Uvira' after AFC/M23 withdrawal
events.description: The Congolese army said Monday it had regained control of the strategic eastern city of Uvira after Rwanda-backed M23 fighters withdrew, following days of shifting troop movements. The pullout ends weeks of rebel presence in the lakeside city near the Burundi border, seized during an AFC/M23 offensive in South Kivu province.

events.title: Pro-Greenland protesters mock Trump's MAGA slogan with 'Make America Go Away' caps
events.description: Mock MAGA hats are becoming a symbol of protest in Denmark as opposition grows to U.S. President Donald Trump’s renewed rhetoric about seizing Greenland

events.title: Ukraine: Families in ‘survival mode’ amid Russian strikes and deadly cold
events.description: Families across Ukraine are in “constant survival mode” amid ongoing waves of Russian missile and drone strikes that have left blocks without power for days at a time, while temperatures plunge to deadly lows, the UN Children's Fund (UNICEF) said on Friday.

events.title: West Virginia teacher fired after arrest on child sex abuse charge
events.description: West Virginia teacher Emily Joy Wise, 38, was fired after allegedly sexually abusing a child under 16. She's held on $250,000 bail following her arrest.

events.title: Could events in Syria have a wider impact for Kurds?
events.description: Syrian army takes control of areas formerly under control of Kurdish-led forces.

events.title: Not only is Lake Powell's water level plummeting because of drought, its total capacity is shrinking, too
events.description: Lake Powell, the second-largest human-made reservoir in the US, has lost nearly 7% of its potential storage capacity since 1963, when Glen Canyon Dam was built, a new report shows.

events.title: Bulgaria: President Radev steps down before snap election
events.description: Bulgarian President Rumen Radev has resigned. Within the next three months, the eastern EU member state will hold its eighth parliamentary election in five years.

events.title: Hungary's MOL to buy Serbia's Russia-owned NIS oil company if US approves
events.description: Hungary’s MOL Group energy company said on Monday they have signed a preliminary agreement to buy a 56.15% stake in Serbia’s Russia-owned main oil supplier that has been sanctioned by the United States

events.title: India agrees to boost trade and strategic ties with UAE amid regional tensions
events.description: India and the UAE are aiming to double bilateral trade to $200 billion by 2032

events.title: ISIS fighters break free from Syrian jail amid chaotic government handover
events.description: U.S. military boosts regional presence with F-15 fighter jets and USS Abraham Lincoln deployment as ISIS prison break highlights security risks amid Syria's political realignment.

events.title: Gunmen abduct dozens of worshippers from multiple Nigerian churches using sophisticated weapons
events.description: Gunmen allegedly abducted dozens of worshippers from two churches in Nigeria's Kaduna state, with security forces deployed to track the captors.

events.title: Vietnam’s To Lam vows to fight corruption, pledges 10% economic growth
events.description: The Communist Party leader is reportedly considering a dual role as party chief and Vietnam's president.

events.title: Look of the Week: Blackpink headline Coachella in Korean hanboks
events.description: Bringing the second day of this year's Coachella to a close, K-Pop girl group Blackpink made history Saturday night when they became the first Asian act to ever headline the festival. To a crowd of, reportedly, over 125,000 people, Jennie, Jisoo, Lisa and Rosé used the ground-breaking moment to pay homage to Korean heritage by arriving onstage in hanboks: a traditional type of dress.

events.title: How Playboy cut ties with Hugh Hefner to create a post-MeToo brand
events.description: Hugh Hefner launched Playboy Magazine 70 years ago this year. The first issue included a nude photograph of Marilyn Monroe, which he had purchased and published without her knowledge or consent.

events.title: China’s population falls again as birthrate drops 17% to record low
events.description: Fourth year of decline deepens concerns over ageing, shrinking workforce and long-term economic impact China’s population fell for a fourth consecutive year in 2025 as the birthrate plunged to another record low despite the introduction of polices aimed at encouraging people to have children. Registered births dropped to 7.92 million in 2025 – or 5.63 for every 1,000 members of the population – down 17% from 9.54 million in 2024, and the lowest since records began in 1949. Continue reading...

events.title: Germany-US rift is looming after a year of Trump
events.description: The second term of US President Donald Trump has brought unprecedented strain on once-solid German-American relations. The issue of Greenland could be a tipping point. DW looks back on a year of trans-Atlantic tensions.

events.title: Congolese soldiers reenter key eastern city after M23 rebels' withdrawal, army and residents say
events.description: Congolese soldiers and pro-government militia fighters have reentered the strategic town of Uvira

events.title: Venezuela’s acting leader was once a DEA 'priority target': report
events.description: Venezuela's interim president Delcy Rodríguez was reportedly labeled a DEA "priority target" in 2022, appearing in intelligence files since at least 2018.

events.title: Big-box stores could help slash emissions and save millions by putting solar panels on roofs. Why aren't more of them doing it?
events.description: As the US attempts to wean itself off its heavy reliance on fossil fuels and shift to cleaner energy sources, many experts are eyeing a promising solution: your neighborhood big-box stores and shopping malls.

events.title: Confronted over Greenland, Europe is ditching its softly-softly approach to Trump
events.description: Transatlantic relations aren't broken, though they are damaged. And if Europeans want to try to cut through with Trump, they'll have to stick together, writes Europe Editor Katya Adler

events.title: Ros Atkins on...President Trump's year in numbers
events.description: Executive orders, pardons, trips and Truth Social posts - the BBC’s Analysis Editor breaks down Donald Trump’s first year back in office, in numbers.

events.title: Italian fashion designer Valentino dies aged 93
events.description: One of the giants of 20th century fashion, his creations were worn by celebrities including Elizabeth Taylor, Julia Roberts and Gwyneth Paltrow.

events.title: 'Europe is at a total loss': Russia gloats over Greenland tensions
events.description: The BBC's Russia editor Steve Rosenberg analyses why pro-Russian government papers are full of praise for Donald Trump's desire to buy Greenland.

events.title: Greenland 'will stay Greenland', former Trump adviser declares
events.description: Donald Trump's former chief economic adviser said the US president's actions are a negotiating tactic.

events.title: Ghana arrests Nigerians accused of running cyber-crime networks
events.description: There is a growing trend of foreigners being lured to Ghana under the pretext of lucrative work.

events.title: China's birth rate hits record low as population continues to shrink
events.description: Beijing has been trying hard to encourage more young people to marry and have children.

events.title: Japan PM Takaichi calls snap election three months after taking office
events.description: Sanae Takaichi, who took office last October, hopes the vote will give her a stronger mandate.

events.title: 'Shameful' and 'terrible look' - the chaos that marred Senegal's Afcon triumph
events.description: Senegal beat Morocco to win the Africa Cup of Nations after the final is overshadowed when they temporarily refuse to play.

events.title: Gaza’s ‘phase two’ from a distance: Why hope still feels out of reach
events.description: As Washington hails next stage of truce, Gaza sees a stark disconnect between promises and the deadly reality.

events.title: Bangladeshi Gen Z toppled Hasina. Now they could decide next prime minister
events.description: Young people, who make up 44 percent of voters, ousted Hasina. But they've never seen a competitive election, until now.

events.title: UK to consider Australia-style ban on social media for children
events.description: UK ministers will visit Australia to gather information on the social media ban for under-16s implemented last month.

events.title: Norway PM: Trump ‘preoccupied’ with Nobel Peace Prize on Greenland texts
events.description: Norway PM Jonas Gahr Store rebuked Donald Trump after after text exchange involving Greenland and the Nobel Peace Prize.

events.title: Trump’s Gaza ‘Board of Peace’ draws scepticism
events.description: US President Donald Trump has unveiled a proposed “Board of Peace” aimed at rebuilding Gaza.

events.title: Bulgaria’s President Rumen Radev says he will resign ahead of snap election
events.description: Radev widely expected to form his own political party prior to upcoming snap vote.

events.title: Markets digest bank earnings after recent turmoil
events.description: No description available.

events.title: Still haven't filed your taxes? Here's what you need to know
events.description: So far this tax season, the IRS has received more than 90 million income tax returns for 2022.

events.title: Analysis: Fox News is about to enter the true No Spin Zone
events.description: This is it.

events.title: Scientists identify secret ingredient in Leonardo da Vinci paintings
events.description: "Old Masters" such as Leonardo da Vinci, Sandro Botticelli and Rembrandt may have used proteins, especially egg yolk, in their oil paintings, according to a new study.

events.title: 'A definitive backslide.' Inside fashion's worrying runway trend
events.description: Now that the Fall-Winter 2023 catwalks have been disassembled, it's clear one trend was more pervasive than any collective penchant for ruffles, pleated skirts or tailored coats.

events.title: Michael Jordan's 1998 NBA Finals sneakers sell for a record $2.2 million
events.description: In 1998, Michael Jordan laced up a pair of his iconic black and red Air Jordan 13s to bring home a Bulls victory during Game 2 of his final NBA championship — and now they are the most expensive sneakers ever to sell at auction. The game-winning sneakers sold for $2.2 million at Sotheby's in New York on Tuesday, smashing the sneaker auction record of $1.47 million, set in 2021 by a pair of Nike Air Ships that Jordan wore earlier in his career.

events.title: Here's the real reason to turn on airplane mode when you fly
events.description: We all know the routine by heart: "Please ensure your seats are in the upright position, tray tables stowed, window shades are up, laptops are stored in the overhead bins and electronic devices are set to flight mode."

events.title: 'I was up to my waist down a hippo's throat.' He survived, and here's his advice
events.description: Paul Templer was living his best life.

events.title: Relaxed entry rules make it easier than ever to visit this stunning Asian nation
events.description: Due to its remoteness and short summer season, Mongolia has long been a destination overlooked by travelers.

events.title: The most beautiful sections of China's Great Wall
events.description: Having lived in Beijing for almost 12 years, I've had plenty of time to travel widely in China.

events.title: Sign up to our newsletter for a weekly roundup of travel news
events.description: No description available.

events.title: Confidence runs high in London’s Little Morocco as Afcon glory beckons
events.description: Atlas Lions face Senegal in final of Africa Cup of Nations on Sunday and Moroccan diaspora scents victory London’s Little Morocco is brimming with pride and anticipation. The Moroccan diaspora in North Kensington is in no doubt that on Sunday the Atlas Lions will triumph against Senegal in the final of the Africa Cup of Nations. “There’s not just an excitement, it has completely taken over everything else,” said Souad Talsi, who runs the Al-Hasaniya Moroccan women’s centre at the base of 31-storey Trellick Tower, at the north end of Golborne Road. Continue reading...

events.title: Chinese tourists shun Japan in wake of Taiwan invasion row
events.description: Number of high-spending Chinese tourists visiting Japan halved last month after PM said an invasion of Taiwan could spark Japanese military involvement Chinese tourism to Japan almost halved in December amid a bitter diplomatic row between Beijing and Tokyo over the security of Taiwan . The number of tourists from mainland China dropped by about 45% from the same month a year earlier to about 330,000, Japan’s transport ministry said on Tuesday. Continue reading...

events.title: Norway says Trump cited Nobel loss when discussing Greenland
events.description: The prime minister of Norway says President Trump cited the Nobel Prize as a reason for not pursuing a peaceful resolution on Greenland.

events.title: 4 million kilos of potatoes given away for free in Berlin
events.description: As an initiative redistributes a bumper surplus of spuds, here's a look at the Germans' great love affair with the potato.

events.title: Italian fashion designer Valentino dies aged 93
events.description: The legendary fashion designer founded his namesake company in 1959 in Rome.

events.title: A cow has learned to use sticks to scratch herself — a scientific first
events.description: A cow in Austria has been observed using tools ― the first time such behavior has been recorded in cattle. Have we underestimated the gentle bovines all this time?

events.title: The key elections in Africa in 2026
events.description: Benin's parliamentary elections and Uganda's general elections, both held in January, marked the beginning of a busy and decisive year at ballot boxes across the African continent.

events.title: Human cost of wildlife conservation in Tanzania
events.description: Trophy hunting interests are turning the screw on northern Tanzania's Maasai communities and wildlife paradise. Meanwhile, well-funded conservation efforts are attracting scrutiny amid rising Maasai eviction cases.

events.title: AFCON 2025: Kylian Mbappé and Luis Enrique support Brahim Diaz
events.description: Kylian Mbappé and Luis Enrique defended Brahim Diaz after his failed Panenka penalty in the AFCON final.

events.title: French prime minister to push 2026 budget through parliament without vote
events.description: French Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu has announced he will invoke Article 49.3 of the Constitution to pass the 2026 budget bill into law without parliamentary approval. He admitted that resorting to this tool represented a 'partial failure' as he had promised not to do so. But after a host of concessions the government has made, he is betting he now has enough political support, notably from the Socialists, to survive even if no-confidence motions were filed.

events.title: A 'joyful' designer who worked on 'elevating the beauty of women': Valentino dead at 93
events.description: Speaking on FRANCE 24, fashion journalist Dana Thomas pays tribute to the legendary Valentino, a 'joyful and joyous' fashion designer who worked on 'elevating the beauty of women'. Valentino Garavani passed away on Monday aged 93 at his home in Rome.

events.title: Replay: French PM Lecornu to trigger special power to break budget deadlock
events.description: French Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu confirmed on Monday that he would ram his budget bill through parliament without a vote using special constitutional powers, conceding it was a "partial failure", after weeks of stalled negotiations.

events.title: Trump's extraordinary letter to Norway about Greenland - in full and fact-checked
events.description: The letter from US President Donald Trump to the prime minister of Norway over his demand to take "complete and total control of Greenland" is extraordinary.

events.title: Trump's peace board invitation is a gift for Putin
events.description: So invading your neighbour is apparently no barrier to being an arbiter of peace.

events.title: What is mysterious iron 'bar' in space?
events.description: Astronomers have spotted a mysterious cloud in the shape of a bar 2,600 light-years from Earth.

events.title: Marine Le Pen faces crucial Paris appeals trial over misuse of EU funds
events.description: Marine Le Pen's political future is uncertain as she faces an appeals trial in Paris

events.title: North Korea's Kim dismisses vice premier over factory project
events.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un has dismissed a vice premier for causing “man-made confusions” in works to modernize a major machinery plant

events.title: Syrian government forces clash with Kurdish fighters as IS prisoners escape
events.description: A deal between the Syrian government and the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces seems to be unraveling

events.title: Bulgaria's left-leaning President Rumen Radev says he is stepping down
events.description: Bulgaria’s President Rumen Radev says he is stepping down from the mostly ceremonial job

events.title: What to know about Syria's main Kurdish-led force and its deal with Damascus
events.description: The Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces are set to merge into the Syrian army after suffering major setbacks

events.title: Five face trial in Peru in rare prosecution over the killing of an Amazon defender
events.description: Five men are set to stand trial in Peru over the 2023 killing of an Indigenous Amazon defender

events.title: US Catholic cardinals urge Trump administration to embrace a moral compass in foreign policy
events.description: Three U.S. Catholic cardinals have urged the Trump administration to use a moral compass in foreign policy

events.title: Trump's Board of Peace has several invited leaders trying to figure out how it'll work
events.description: An Israeli official says the nation has been asked to join U.S. President Donald Trump’s new Board of Peace that will supervise the next phase of the Gaza peace plan

events.title: Retired South Carolina couple found dead in homicides at home
events.description: Beloved church members Larry and Sandra Moore found dead in their South Carolina home. The faithful couple described as "backbones" of their congregation.

events.title: Charlie Kirk’s widow Erika Kirk demands speedy trial, alleging 'undue delay' from Tyler Robinson defense
events.description: In a court filing made public over the weekend, Erika Kirk's attorney notified the court that she is invoking her rights to a speedy trial as a victim under Utah law.

events.title: Portland DA cracks down on drug crimes as Seattle pulls back on enforcement
events.description: Portland DA announces drug prosecution crackdown for those refusing treatment, contrasting sharply with Seattle's lenient approach to possession cases.

events.title: ICE agent confronts agitators interfering with alleged child sex offender arrest and more top headlines
events.description: Get all the stories you need-to-know from the most powerful name in news delivered first thing every morning to your inbox.

events.title: Harvard student exposes 'systematic' liberal bias forcing conservatives to avoid certain classes
events.description: Harvard student says "systematic" bias exists at Ivy League school, with conservative students avoiding courses due to left-leaning faculty influence.

events.title: Trump confirms he invited Putin to join his Board of Peace: 'He's been invited'
events.description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Monday confirmed Russian President Vladimir Putin was invited to the Board of Peace for supervision of the Gaza plan.

events.title: Denmark ramps up defenses in Greenland as Trump zeros in on control of territory
events.description: Denmark deploys additional troops to Greenland after President Donald Trump claims the island is not secure from Russia or China.
